description:
Maybe you missed XP Days 2012 because the conference was sold out or the date didn't suit you. Maybe you want to see the sessions you missed because you could only attend one out of five tracks at a time? Maybe you want your colleagues and friends to attend that great session you attended?

Mini XP Day is your second chance to see 12 of the favourite sessions of last year's XP Days.

This one day conference costs 210,00€ + VAT

Please register on the Mini XP Days site

Registration closes on 19/04/2012
name: Mini XP-Days

description:
This semester, the UCL launched a pilot project: An android Agile project. 60 students organized in groups of 4 followed a lightweight Agile process to build one of their very own ideas. You can read more about it here: http://www.agilebelgium.org/2013/03/12/an-android-agile-project-at-the-university-of-louvain-la-neuve/

The goal of this user group is a first attempt to bring more agilists in universities. It would be an opportunity to exchange on different topics and see how we can help each other.

We will present how the different groups approached the implementation of their mobile application and what was expected of them, then we will have 6 groups present their app and share their experience.

Ever wanted to see some Agile at the university? Don't miss it!

The event will take place in auditorium BARB94.
name: Agile @ the university (UCL)

description:
What's a User Group ?


An Agile user group is a group of people who enjoy using Agile methods (Scrum, XP, KanBan,…) who meet regularly to discuss the use of those methods, share knowledge and experience, hear from peers and hold other related activities. They may host special interest workgroups, often focusing on one particular aspect of Agile. This User group will be focussed on Agile Games, we will also briefly discuss the Agile Belgium Community’s events.

What's an Agile Game ?


Agile Games are…games we usually use to teach about Agile. They can be very general e.g. experience what is Scrum through a game. Or they can be focussed on one topic e.g. planning. It’s a fun and powerful way of learning.

What's this meetup is all about ???

All informations about this event are available here: http://www.agilebelgium.org/2013/04/19/agile-games-night-ii-brussels-6th-of-june/
how_to_find_us: Someone from Ogone will welcome you at the front door
name: Agile Games Night II

Contact Informations:

Daniel's phone [masked]

name: Agile Belgium Drinkup 28

description:
Dears,


This event is one of the biggest of the year, if you want to attend only few Agile events in Belgium...you don't want to miss this one!

Attention! To register for this event you need to register via www.atbru.be


An Agile Conference will take place on September, 27 in Belgium: Agile Tour Brussels 2013 (2nd edition)
Registration is open and Program is available on our website www.atbru.be.

At Agile Tour Brussels, there will be both local and international speakers (U.S, U.K, France, Luxembourg, Italy) coming from various industries like IT, Game Development, Research, Teaching, Marketing...

You will learn and practice themes like Agile, Scrum, Kanban, XP, Lean, Innovation Games, Agile Games, Systems Thinking, Lean Startup and also Problem Solving and Soft Skills.
During the conference 2 type of sessions are proposed:
A Talk : Presenter is speaking for most of the time (often from a slide deck), with audience interaction
or a Workshop : Primarily focused on hands-on participation with the audience.

The balanced program offers you the possibility to choose anytime you want a session that could be for Beginners, Practitioners or Experts.
With 30minute-break between sessions and lunches, the Agile Tour Brussels is surely a good place for Networking. Last year we welcomed people from Belgium, France, the Netherlands and Switzerland.
You can buy your ticket via the "Register" link on our website:
Until August, 31st 2013, Price is 70EUR vat excl.
After August, 31st 2013, Price is 100EUR vat excl.

There is a limited number of tickets available so don’t hesitate to register.
All information: Program, venue, prices,... are available on our website: http://www.atbru.be.

You can also support us:

Forward this text to your contacts, to your network
or add this signature to your email:

REGISTER NOW for the Agile Tour Brussels 2013 (2nd edition) #atbru

We hope to see you there!

On behalf of the organization team,

Bruno.
[masked]
how_to_find_us: you need to register via www.atbru.be
name: Agile Tour Brussels 2013

description:
iLean, one of the sponsors of XP Days Benelux hosts a tryout of the session "TDD from the outside in with Rails" by MIchel Grootjans in Kontich on November 19th from 17:30.

This meetup is free but you have to register on the iLean site: http://www.ilean.be/course/tdd20131119

Session description:

You've heard all the hype about Ruby and you've heard how great Rails is. Typical demos show you how you can generate an 'application' in a few minutes. In this workshop however, you will gain an understanding that most tutorials skip in favor of generation voodoo magic. We'll be building a small application from scratch in Ruby on Rails, driven by features and unit tests.
You will have the chance to get behind the keyboard and write a test or implement some code.
Why would you want to learn about Ruby or Rails?
Learning about new technologies and practices tends to generate new ideas in your current job.
While you don't have to agree with the whole concept, some ideas in the Rails stack are real nuggets
name: XP Days tryout @ iLean: TDD with Rails

description:
XP Days Benelux is an international conference where we learn to bring software to life and grow mature systems that support business needs.

It provides an excellent environment for exchanging ideas, hands-on exercises and extreme experiences. This two day conference offers 30 sessions from international and local speakers.

The keyword for this year is "in depth": sessions are longer than before so that you can really explore the session topics.

All information, program and registration is available at http://www.xpday.net

Please note: this is a paid event. You'll have to register at the http://www.xpday.net site
name: XP Days Benelux 2013

description:
For this meetup, organizer is Peter Moreno contact him if you have any questions ([masked] [masked])


What is your style for Agile Coaching?

Have you noticed that each Agile Coach has its own personal imprint and worldview for Agile Coaching? What is yours? and if you are not an Agile Coach yet, how can you get inspired from this observation?. 
We want to hold a space for sharing and reflecting on our style as Agile Coaches and how we contribute to the Agile Movement from this personal perspective. We are all Individuals, we are all Unique!

Agenda

18.50 to 19.00  - Welcoming
19.00 to 20.00 - Sharing your Agile Coaching Style
20.00 to 21.00 - Expanding our perspective of Agile Coaching
21.00 to 21.30 - Goodbye

Logistic

Date: March 26
Time: 19:00 hrs to 21:00
Location: Agilar offices - Koning Albertlaan[masked] Gent

Limit capacity : 10 people and after this we can have a waiting list. If necessary we will find a location with bigger capacity, this will depend on the amount of people we get interested. If you would like to you can mentioned my as co-organizer for this event.

Organizers
Agile Coaches from Agilar.
name: Agile Coaching Dojo

name: Agile Belgium Drinkup 31

description:
Event organized by Agile Consortium Belgium

See http://www.agileconsortium.net/news/agile-risk-management-0512-diegem/ for details and registration.

Alan Moran will present his latest book on Agile Risk Management, which is a premiere for Belgium.

Everyone is going Agile, but what does it mean for risk management? Agile Risk Management is concerned with the identification, assessment, treatment and monitoring of risks in agile projects.
This presentation allows you to hear it from Alan himself, who will describe the processes, principles and practices of agile risk management giving you an oversight of practical tools that can be applied in your daily work enabling you to not only manage risk but to do so in an agile manner.
name: Agile Consortium Belgium: Agile Risk Management

description:
Did you miss out on XP Days 2013 because the conference was sold out? Or the date didn't suit you? Did you want to see some sessions again that you missed? Or perhaps you like to refer your colleagues and friends to attend that great session you experienced? 

Mini XP Day is your second chance.

We rerun 10 of the best sessions of last year's sold out XP Days Conference. See http://www.xpday.net for program and registration. Topics include agile analysis, refactoring, creativity, continuous improvement and an introduction to agile by playing.

Attention: this is a paid event. See the XP Day site for all details.
name: Mini XP Day Benelux

description:
Conference organized by Devops Days.

See http://devopsdays.org/events/2014-belgium/ for all details about session proposals and registration.

The conference that brings development and operations together.

This is the 5th anniversary edition. We are inviting people to think about the things they want to see solved in the future. Or the speakers they'd love to hear about where they think the future is heading. To broaden the discussion and our own horizons, we like to invite people from outside IT, to give their valuable view on our little own ecosystem. Why not learn from other sciences like philosophy, psychology , religion, building engineering , group dynamics. We don't have to invent our own wheel, we can learn from others. After all the people/culture part is the hard part, we should use all help we could get.

Propose sessions or speakers at http://devopsdays.org/events/2014-belgium/propose/
name: Devops Days Belgium

description:
Join us for a drink the evening before Agile Tour Brussels. Meet participants, speakers and members of the Belgian Agile Community for a friendly chat.

The first round is on Agile Systems and the organizers of the conference

The meetup is at the "Delirium Cafe" (http://deliriumcafe.be/) in the centre of Brussels which boasts an enormous collection of different beers. How to find us:
- from the "rue des Bouchers" enter the "impasse de la fidélité"
- go past the "Delirum Monasterium"
- enter the "Delirium Cafe", the one with the pink elephant on the sign
- at the left there's a winding staircase. Go upstairs
- find the Agile Tour organizers (see http://atbru.be for their pictures) or look for the table(s) with Post-its and beers

Call: [masked] if you get lost in Brussels
name: Pre-Agile Tour Drinkup
